headline: Ford tells dealers prices could go up in June if Trump’s tariffs remain
summary: Ford is warning its dealers that tariffs will likely raise prices in the coming months, the latest impact the import taxes will have on Americans’ finances.

raw.headline: Ford tells dealers prices could go up in June if Trump’s tariffs remain
raw.summary: Ford is warning its dealers that tariffs will likely raise prices in the coming months, the latest impact the import taxes will have on Americans’ finances.

headline: Ford Plans Price Hikes This Summer Without Tariff Relief
summary: Ford Motor is warning it will likely have to increase prices on new vehicles arriving at dealerships this summer, if President Trump doesn’t back off his tariff plan.  The Dearborn, Mich.-based automaker told dealers in a memo Wednesday that it anticipates having to take this action, starting with new cars, SUVs and trucks coming off the production line in May. Those models would hit dealer lots in June and July.  The automaker remains committed to holding prices steady until June 2 and continuing to run its previously unveiled employee-pricing-for-all promotion during that time, according to the memo sent by Andrew Frick, the executive in charge of Ford’s gas- and electric-car divisions.

Those models would hit dealer lots in June and July.  The automaker remains committed to holding prices steady until June 2 and continuing to run its previously unveiled employee-pricing-for-all promotion during that time, according to the memo sent by Andrew Frick, the executive in charge of Ford’s gas- and electric-car divisions.

headline: Charles Schwab, Ford, Microsoft: Trending Tickers
summary: Madison Mills examines some of today's trending tickers on Catalysts. Charles Schwab (SCHW) reports record-high first quarter revenue driven by an uptick in trading volume amid market volatility. Ford (F) considers price increases as the American automaker assesses the impact of President Trump's tariff policies. Microsoft (MSFT) stock receives a downgrade from Keybanc to Sector Weight from Overweight, citing artificial intelligence (AI) demand and monetization concerns. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Ford recalls more than 148,000 vehicles, NHTSA says
summary: Ford Motor is recalling more than 148,000 vehicles in the United States as part of two recalls, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday. The automaker will recall 123,611 vehicles due to a fluid leak that could reduce braking performance and increase stopping distance. This affects certain 2017–18 Ford F-150, Expedition, and Lincoln Navigator models.
